intro: Rhynchospora exigua, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its slender, grass-like stems are topped with small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Rhynchospora exigua plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
